intro: Machaeranthera heterophylla, commonly known as the variableleaf blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, and it has a taproot system that allows it to survive in arid conditions. Its leaves are variable in shape, ranging from lance-shaped to nearly round, which contributes to its common name. Machaeranthera heterophylla is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various therapeutic purposes.
